subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Reporting
msgSnippet: Hi, Thanks. But while building i get some error java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/xalan/xslt/XSLTInputSource at
messageBody:
Hi,

Thanks. But while building i get some error

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/xalan/xslt/XSLTInputSource
at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.XMLResultAggregator.crea
teReport(XMLResultAggregator.java:114)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.IntrospectionHelper$1.create(IntrospectionHelper
.java:167)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.IntrospectionHelper.createElement(IntrospectionH
elper.java:275)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectHelper$NestedElementHandler.init(ProjectH
elper.java:535)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectHelper$TaskHandler.startElement(ProjectHe
lper.java:499)
at com.sun.xml.parser.Parser.maybeElement(Parser.java:1391)
at com.sun.xml.parser.Parser.content(Parser.java:1499)

------ and more
Tried searching for the file but seems Xalan.jar doesnot have this
class. Could you recommend
where can i find ?

Thanks.




"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> >So said Ranjeet Sahay on 2003-05-08 --------------------
> >Hi,
> >
> >Is there a way of creating report with JUnit which displays how many
> >tests passed
> >and how many failed(with possibly more details). The GUI is not
> >sufficient for reporting tests (which may be over 5000 running over
> >hours).
> >
> >I have logs (using log4j) to look at but becomes awfull searching for
>
> >failures in maze of results. I have seen stuffs at IBM sites and also
>
> >can be made using
> >ant junitreport. But is there more easier way of making reports using
>
> >JUnit(add-on may be).
> >
> >Desparately look for easier way for reporting.
>
> Ant with JUnitReport. Have fun.
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> President, Diaspar Software Services
